sets.name: Defensive
sets.description: Tera Fairy helps improve Slowbro's matchup against threats like Slither Wing, Tyranitar, and Mimikyu.

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description: Tera Ghost is used to power up Shadow Ball, giving Gengar a decent chance to OHKO Quagsire and Talonflame and 2HKO specially defensive Gastrodon. Tera Fairy is an alternative that lets Gengar resist moves such as Sucker Punch from Bisharp and Lokix.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description: Tera Ghost makes up for Choice Scarf Gengar's lack of power, ensuring that it can 2HKO Quagsire. Tera Fairy lets Gengar resist Sucker Punch from Bisharp and Lokix.

sets.name: Substitute + 3 Attacks
sets.description: Tera Ghost ensures that Gengar can 2HKO Quagsire. Tera Fairy lets it resist Sucker Punch from Bisharp and Lokix. Leftovers should always be run instead of Black Sludge to prevent self-damage when Terastillizing.

sets.name: Nasty Plot
sets.description: Tera Ghost powers up Gengar's Shadow Ball, possibly OHKOing Gastrodon at +2 and maximizing its damage versus Unaware Quagsire, all while removing its Ground weakness. Tera Fairy prevents Sucker Punch users such as Bisharp and Lokix from revenge killing it.

sets.name: Hex
sets.description: Tera Ghost powers up Gengar's Hex, 2HKOing a burned Gastrodon and removing its Ground weakness, letting it potentially beat it one-on-one. Tera Fairy allows Gengar to resist Sucker Punch from Bisharp and Lokix. Leftovers should always be run instead of Black Sludge to prevent self-damage when Terastillizing.

sets.name: Bulk Up
sets.description: Tera Fighting helps strengthen the power of Close Combat. Alternatively, Tera Electric strengthens the power of Wild Charge towards Slowking and can catch Talonflame attempting to hit Paldean Tauros-F with Brave Bird.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description: Tera Fighting helps remove the Stealth Rock weakness from Paldean Tauros-F and increases the power of Close Combat.

sets.name: Unaware Wall
sets.description:
Tera Poison prevents Quagsire from being poisoned by Grafaiai while improving its matchup versus Slither Wing and Lucario. Water Absorb sets also benefit from it improving its matchup versus Tera Grass Barraskewda and Floatzel.

Tera Steel also prevents poison, gives Quagsire the opportunity to surprise Toxtricity and Staraptor, and lets it beat Maushold. Water Absorb sets should avoid using this Tera type due to Close Combat Barraskewda beating it.

Tera Ghost lets Quagsire spinblock, keeping its entry hazards up while helping versus Lucario regardless of Quagsire's ability, all while providing an immunity to Boomburst from Toxtricity and Noivern.

sets.name: Defensive Pivot
sets.description: Tera Fairy lets Slowking improve its matchups against Slither Wing, Tyranitar, and Sandy Shocks. Tera Water lets Slowking power up its Surf to better threaten targets like Slither Wing and Unaware Quagsire, and it removes its weakness to Bug- and Dark-type moves from Slither Wing and Bisharp.

sets.name: Calm Mind
sets.description:
Colbur Berry lets Slowking stay in against Pokemon like Iron Jugulis, Tyranitar, and Bisharp, threatening them with boosted attacks without Terastillizing.

Tera Fairy lets Slowking improve its matchups against Slither Wing and Sandy Shocks. Tera Water lets Slowking power up its Surf to better threaten targets like Slither Wing and Unaware Quagsire, and it removes its weakness to Bug- and Dark-type moves from Slither Wing and Bisharp.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
Tera Flying gives Tyranitar a Ground immunity and a Fighting and Bug resistance, helping it versus Pokemon such as Slither Wing, Gastrodon, and Gengar.

Tera Fairy similarly helps Tyranitar versus Slither Wing and Gengar while letting it pressure boosted Salamence and Haxorus.

Tera Rock is a more offensive option that increases the power of its Stone Edge while still having defensive application versus Gengar by removing its 4x weakness to Focus Blast and retaining its Special Defense boost in sand.

sets.name: Dragon Dance
sets.description: Tera Flying lets Tyranitar set up against Pokemon like Donphan and Slither Wing while preventing it from being revenge killed by First Impression from Lokix and Slither Wing.

sets.name: Stealth Rock
sets.description: Tera Fairy removes Tyranitar's Focus Blast weakness to potentially beat Gengar while letting it check Slither Wing. Tera Flying is an alternative that lets it beat Donphan as a Stealth Rock setter while similarly providing a Fighting resistance.

sets.name: Rain Setter
sets.description: Tera Ground allows Pelipper to be immune to Electric-type attacks from foes like Sandy Shocks, Kilowattrel, and Toxtricity, being able to retaliate with a powerful Hydro Pump, while also removing its Stealth Rock weakness.

sets.name: Dragon Dance
sets.description: Tera Steel lets Salamence set up against Pokemon like Scream Tail, Grafaiai, and Choice-locked Noivern and Staraptor. Tera Flying powers up Salamence's Dual Wingbeat, letting it OHKO Gastrodon at +1 without locking into Outrage.

sets.name: 3 Attacks Roost
sets.description:
Tera Fairy removes Salamence's weakness to Stealth Rock and Noivern's Draco Meteor while retaining its good matchup against Slither Wing.

Tera Steel lets it check Grafaiai, Maushold, and Staraptor, and revenge kill Lucario even when weakened.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description: Tera Flying increases Staraptor's damage against targets such as Tinkaton, 2HKOing it. Tera Normal can be used to remove its Stealth Rock weakness. However, Double-Edge isn't as spammable as Brave Bird due to the presence of Ghost-types.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description: Tera Flying increases Staraptor's damage against targets such as Tinkaton and Quagsire, possibly OHKOing the latter. Tera Ground can be used to provide a resistance to Stealth Rock and mitigate chip damage while taking advantage of the fact Choice Band Staraptor already has very little defensive counterplay.

sets.name: Specially Defensive Wall
sets.description:
Tera Poison allows Gastrodon to resist Fighting-type attacks from Slither Wing and Hawlucha, as well as Power Whip from Tsareena. It also gains a Toxic immunity, which lets it beat foes like Grafaiai, and it resists other miscellaneous attacks such as Play Rough from Mimikyu and First Impression from Lokix.

Tera Ghost allows Gastrodon to stop Rapid Spin users such as Tsareena and Donphan from removing its entry hazards, although it should be wary of the latter's high Attack. It also resists Slither Wing's STAB moves and shuts down Swords Dance Lucario.

Tera Steel lets Gastrodon resist Normal-type attacks from Toxtricity, Maushold, Noivern, and Staraptor, although the latter two carry coverage options to hit it super effectively.

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description: Inner Focus prevents Lucario from having its Attack dropped by Salamence's Intimidate, but Justified is an option to gain value from Knock Off when switching into Grafaiai for setup opportunities. Tera Normal lets Lucario gain a STAB bonus on its Extreme Speed to sweep teams after setting up.

sets.name: Nasty Plot
sets.description:
Tera Fairy allows Rotom-C to resist First Impression from Lokix and Slither Wing aiming to revenge kill it. Tera Fairy also helps Rotom-C take attacks like Close Combat from Lucario and cripple it with Will-O-Wisp.

Tera Steel also prevents Rotom-C from being revenge killed by Lokix and Slither Wing while gaining a Toxic immunity, allowing it to switch into Quagsire without fear.

sets.name: Dragon Dance
sets.description: Tera Steel lets Haxorus gain set up opportunites versus Pokemon such as Scream Tail, Noivern, and Staraptor. It also lets it resist First Impression from Slither Wing.

sets.name: Fast Utility
sets.description:
Tera Ghost allows Talonflame to check Maushold and Swords Dance Lucario, spinblock, and remove its weakness to Stealth Rock if it loses its item. It also gives Talonflame an emergency immunity to Boomburst from Noivern and Toxtricity and lets Taunt sets beat Quagsire and Gastrodon.

Tera Steel instead lets Talonflame gain a resistance to Stealth Rock and Extreme Speed, as well as an immunity to Toxic and poison, which helps against Grafaiai. It can also let it serve as a serviceable Staraptor switch-in, although it must beware of Close Combat. It must also be careful to not Terastallize if it still needs to handle Slither Wing.

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description: Frisk lets Noivern scout for items such as Choice Scarf from Sandy Shocks. Infiltrator can be used to hit Gengar with Draco Meteor through Substitute and be more threatening versus dual screens teams. Tera Normal gives Noivern a huge power boost on Boomburst, letting it guarantee an OHKO versus Quagsire.

sets.name: Quiver Dance
sets.description: 52 Speed EVs allows Oricorio-Pom-Pom to outspeed Talonflame after a Quiver Dance, with the remaining EVs being invested in HP and Defense to take hits more easily from priority users like Lokix, Slither Wing, and Lucario. Tera Ground transforms Revelation Dance into a Ground-type attack, hitting foes like Tinkaton, Tyranitar, and Sandy Shocks for super effective damage.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description: Salazzle should rarely be Terastillized, as it loses its 4x resistance to First Impression from Slither Wing and Lokix and doesn't notably benefit from any type change.

sets.name: Utility
sets.description: The given Speed EVs allow Tsareena to outspeed Kilowattrel after a Rapid Spin. Although Tsareena should Terastallize rarely, Tera Steel helps Tsareena act as an emergency check to Staraptor and Gengar by tanking Brave Bird and Sludge Bomb respectively and allowing it to decently chip them.

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description: Tera Normal boosts the power of Boomburst to insane levels, being able to outright OHKO specially defensive Hippowdon and Gastrodon after only one layer of Spikes.

sets.name: Shift Gear
sets.description: Tera Normal boosts the power of Boomburst to insane levels, OHKOing Hippowdon and doing massive damage to Gastrodon and Scream Tail.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description: Tera Normal boosts the power of Boomburst to make up for the decreased power, being able to still have great odds to OHKO Hippowdon after 1 layer of Spikes and 2HKO Gastrodon with no entry hazards on the field.

sets.name: Shell Smash
sets.description:
Tera Blast in conjunction with Tera Fighting gives Polteageist the necessary coverage to break past Dark-types like Tyranitar, Bisharp, and Iron Jugulis that wall it otherwise. Tera Fighting also allows Polteageist to resist Sucker Punch from Bisharp and Accelrock from Lycanroc-D as well as take neutral damage from Mimikyu's Shadow Sneak.

Tera Ghost is an alternative to maximize the power of Shadow Ball towards bulky foes like Tinkaton and Gastrodon. However, Protect should be run over Tera Blast if using Tera Ghost as Tera Blast is now a useless moveslot and Protect helps Polteageist against First Impression users like Lokix and Slither Wing.

sets.name: Offensive Pivot
sets.description:
Poison Touch is used to give Grafaiai a chance to poison while using Knock Off or U-turn. Black Sludge should be used if using Switcheroo to let it cripple switch-ins such as Tinkaton and Gastrodon; Heavy-Duty Boots are otherwise preferable to stay healthier versus Gengar when entry hazards are up.

Grafaiai should very rarely be Terastillized, as its typing is necessary to check Gengar and it will be unable to break past any checks even after powering up its Gunk Shot.

sets.name: Prankster Utility
sets.description:
Prankster lets Grafaiai use a priority Parting Shot versus faster targets such as Noivern and Choice Scarf Sandy Shocks. It can also trap certain Pokemon such as Salamence and Gengar into moves such as Dragon Dance and Substitute, respectively, with Encore.

Grafaiai should very rarely be Terastillized, as its typing is necessary to check Gengar and it will be unable to break past any checks even after powering up its Gunk Shot.

sets.name: Utility
sets.description: Tera Ghost lets Tinkaton spinblock, check Slither Wing, and surprise Pokemon like Tyranitar trying to hit it with Earthquake. It is, however, undesirable to Terastillize Tinkaton, due to needing its typing to check a wide range of threats such as Grafaiai, Noivern, and Maushold.

sets.name: Swords Dance + Two Attacks
sets.description:
Protect lets Tinkaton freely use Gigaton Hammer multiple times, rack up extra passive recovery, and scout moves from Choice-locked Pokemon such as Slither Wing. Encore is an option that locks Pokemon such as Quagsire and Gastrodon into their recovery move, generating free turns.

Tera Dark lets Tinkaton eat a hit from Choice Specs Gengar more comfortably and removes its Ground weakness, which helps against Gastrodon and Quagsire. It is, however, undesirable to Terastillize Tinkaton, due to needing its typing to check a wide range of threats such as Grafaiai, Noivern, and Maushold.

sets.name: Wish Support
sets.description: Scream Tail should very rarely be Terastillized, as its typing is needed to check foes like Gallade, Hawlucha, and Noivern and there are far better users of the mechanic.

sets.name: Dual Screens
sets.description: Scream Tail should very rarely be Terastillized, as its typing is needed to check foes like Gallade, Hawlucha, and Noivern and there are far better users of the mechanic. Additionally, its sole purpose is to set up dual screens and entry hazards, and changing to another type will not make a massive impact compared to another teammate.

sets.name: All-Out-Attacker
sets.description:
Protective Pads is an option that lets Slither Wing more freely attack Talonflame, although Choice Band sets can still potentially OHKO it with Wild Charge while risking one Flame Body burn.

Tera Bug powers up Slither Wing's First Impression and U-turn to maximize its revenge killing potential and chip damage. Tera Ghost is an option to spinblock and check Lucario, Maushold, and opposing Slither Wing. Tera Fighting powers up Close Combat to maximize damage versus Quagsire and Hippowdon.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description: Tera Bug powers up Slither Wing's First Impression and U-turn damage, making it harder to pivot around and letting it revenge kill faster Pokemon such as full HP Floatzel.

sets.name: Bulky Pivot
sets.description:
Morning Sun lets Slither Wing use its typing more effectively to check Pokemon such as opposing Slither Wing and Tsareena. Stun Spore instead lets Slither Wing cripple switch-ins like Salamence and Talonflame to create openings for teammates such as Choice Specs Toxtricity.

Tera Ghost lets Slither Wing spinblock and check Maushold and Lucario. Tera Bug is an alternative that improves its ability to revenge kill Pokemon.

sets.name: Hazards Lead
sets.description: Tera Ghost is used to potentially spinblock while utilizing Sandy Shocks's solid matchup versus Defog users, such as Talonflame, to help keep its entry hazards up.

sets.name: Pivot
sets.description:
Tera Ice lets Sandy Shocks break through Kilowattrel and Hippowdon with Tera Blast, which otherwise wall it. Tera Grass instead lets it OHKO Gastrodon with Tera Blast.

Tera Ground should be used when running entry hazards to put as much pressure on Quagsire and Gastrodon as possible, but Sandy Shocks is not a high-value Terastillization user in this case.

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description:
Tera Ice lets Sandy Shocks break through Kilowattrel and Hippowdon with Tera Blast, which otherwise wall it. Tera Grass instead lets it OHKO Gastrodon with Tera Blast.

Sandy Shocks can alternatively run Power Gem to break Kilowattrel while running Tera Ground to let it 2HKO Gastrodon without giving up its Ground typing.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description: Tera Ground lets Sandy Shocks apply as much pressure as it can against Quagsire and weakened Gastrodon with Earth Power, making it harder for them to take advantage of its Choice lock.
